title: Oakland hoops opens practice: Summer work puts Grizzlies on fast track
text:
MORE For the Oakland basketball team, the first fall practice Sunday night was going to be "first" in name only.
Having 10 practices this summer and three games in Spain, the Golden Grizzlies are further along than many teams who already have practiced for more than a week.
"We're so far ahead, we're not going to have the typical first couple days of walk-throughs, the philosophical offense, the philosophical defense," coach Greg Kampe said. "We've got enough in from the 10 days that we can just go right in."
Sunday's planned practice was expected to be just a "normal end-of-October-type" workout.
Along with teaching the players in Spain, Kampe and his coaching staff — which lost two assistants this summer then added former OU player Drew Valentine and will work in new assistant Dionne Phelps this week — got an education.
Kampe learned that his plan to redshirt the freshmen no longer is realistic.They played and competed at such a high level, they'll need to see the floor.
Big man Brad Brechting and guard Jaevin Cumberland proved they're worthy of being worked into the rotation.
"They both, I feel, will play a role, and Brechting will have a significant role," Kampe said.
Brechting was so impressive that Kampe sees potential to play him alongside starting center Percy Gibson because of their different size and game. Gibson is a 271-pound bruiser, and Brechting gets up and down the floor at 210 pounds.
That combo might be necessary given Kampe's desire to press on defense and push the ball on offense. Without the depth to do it for the past four or five years, this team could go nine to 10 deep. It showed enough athleticism in the three Spain games to prove that's realistic.
Which brings everything back to the practices, where they'll need to get into shape to be able to push through games.
"We've got 30 practices before the first game, and it's my job as a coach to get them into playing shape," Kampe said. "I'm a firm believer the only way you can get in basketball shape is by playing, by pushing yourself when you're tired and not cheating the last 15 minutes of practice when you're going up and down. You can't be taking that time off, you've got to be pushing."
As practice begins — again — the Grizzlies know what to expect.
